title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 175.1 - Commingling money of principal
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 175.1 - Commingling money of principal

State Regulations
A real estate broker shall not commingle the money or other
property of his principal with his own and shall at all times maintain a
separate, special bank account to be used exclusively for the deposit of said
monies and which deposit shall be made within three business days. Until such
time as the money is deposited into a separate, special bank account, it shall
be safeguarded in a secure location so as to prevent loss or misappropriation. Said monies shall not be placed in any depository, fund or investment other
than a federally insured bank account. Accrued interest, if any, shall not be
retained by, or for the benefit of, the broker except to the extent that it is
applied to, and deducted from, earned commission, with the consent of all
parties. Notes

175.1

New

York State Register January 4, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 01, eff. 1/4/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
